name: LordKrishna-YatharthGeeta
0:
”Alexa, open lord krishna”
”Alexa, ask lord krishna to start”
”Start Geeta”
skdetail:
This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: lord krishna
des:
Lord Krishna is known as the supreme power of all, and rightly so. The sacred knowledge he gave to Arjuna on the battlefield of Kurukshetra, which we know today as Bhagavad Gita, still resonates with us and applies to every discerning man of today. You might not have read the holy book, or have any slightest inclination to read the Gita, but you’ll be shocked to see how relevant it is to you and the way you want to live your life in today’s day and age. Don’t believe me? Try this Alexa skill.


Steps for using the skill:

Session 1:
User: Alexa, open lord Krishna
Alexa: Starting lord Krishna teachings, You can say, start, to begin.
User: start
Alexa: This is Lesson <number>
<Alexa completes the story or user interruption>
User: Alexa, next
(to skip to next lesson)
User: Alexa, stop
User: Alexa, shuffle
User: Alexa, next / previous
User: Alexa, resume
User: Alexa, start over
User: Yes/No


Session 2:
User: Alexa, open lord Krishna
Alexa: You were listening to Lesson <number>, Would you like to resume?
User: No
Alexa: <Alexa starts over to the first chapter and you can ask Alexa to step forward by saying Alexa, next> You are listening to the Lord Krishna Lessons. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume.

Session 3:
User: Help
Alexa: You are listening to the Lord Krishna Lessons. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume.

DAILY Lord Krishna - Yatharth Geeta ROUTINE
To add this prayer to a daily timer, follow these steps:
1 - Open your Alexa App.
2 - Select Routines.
3 - Select Schedule, add a time (say 7 AM).
4 - Choose Skills / Your Skills.
5 - Choose 'Lord Krishna - Yatharth Geeta'. Done.
priv: The developer reported that this skill does not collect personal information.
